reviews.review_msg: Unclear lecture and pretty hard midterms. It would not be a easy course if u haven't taken any Ling course.

not quite helpful person. just read her notes and you don't need to attend most the lectures. her garding is kinda fair, but not fair enough. she didn't use heart to prepare the course. the lecture notes are directly from one of her other linguistic class. anyway, its a easy credit, but not for A grade finders.

Everything in the slides makes it into the exams/quizzes. The assigned readings were relevant and interesting. Though the course has no prerequisites, knowing basic linguistic concepts and the IPA would help, a lot. She's clear in her presentations, expectations, and goals for the course.

I took long 280 with her lectures were super engaging and interesting, you can tell she cares about her students and she made the class fun and enjoyable to learn. Her exams were fair expect I found her quizzes were a bit more difficult than I expected but when the class told her it got fixed. Over all great, kind prof and would recommend

Really enjoyed her class - but definitely go over your marks against the answer key! Sometimes her multiple choice is poorly worded. That being said - She's very much willing to provide feedback if you ask. Very knowledgeable. I'll definitely take another course with her if the opportunity presents itself. Easy A if you're into speech science.
